title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:28  has quit 01:17  has quit 01:46  What does 'Failed to execute the [velocity] macro' mean? It appears when I attempt to Update when on the OpenOffice Server page. It does not appear to be very informative as to what corrective action should be taken... 01:47  if you click on it (and have javascript enabled) it should expand and tell you what happened. 01:47  Okay. Will check. 01:47  But if you didn't write it then basicly what it means is "we messed up" 01:48  Nope, nothing shows when I click. 01:48  I'm trying to get the OpenOffice (well LibreOffice) running. I might not have everything right but I'd hoped it would tell me something useful if I did not. 01:49  You click in the words "Failed to execute the [velocity] macro" and it doesn't expand? 01:49  Got a few minutes before dinner... well take that back. Dinner call just came! Check back later if the hurricane doesn't take down power. 01:49  heh 01:49  ok 01:49  Yes, clicked and nothing. It highlights the word I click on. 01:49  Back later. 01:50  Ok, if you run noscript (like me) then make sure javascript is allowed because it required js (when you get back ofc) 02:16  has joined #xwiki 02:17  has quit 02:37  okay. back from dinner 02:38  where do you enable js? config edit in /var/..../xwiki.properties or from Administration? 02:45  if you don't know about enabling javascript then it should already be working. 02:46  Just some of us are security paranoid and the like and we want most websites to not be allowed to run js so I use a firefox addon called noscript when prevents it unless I explicitly give a website permission to run it. 02:47  what web browser are you using? 02:54  Firefox 02:54  Ah, so you mean the browser config. I will check that 02:55  No, if you normally see websites correctly then you have javascript enabled. 02:56  Yeah, no particular problems, although I do keep the feature enabled that lets me accept/deny each cookie that someone tries to send. That should not effect anything here though. 02:57  It shouldn't. Still that message should be expanding, would you care to post a screenshot or pastebin the page source? I would like to understand why it is not working for you. 03:01  Interesting note: I do get a change of pointer to fingertip from arrow when I mouseover, but nothing comes up. 03:02  And I got "Read technical information related to this error", but clicking brings nothing further up. 03:02  I have the screen shots. Send me an email and I'll attach the shots 03:04  And the source htm dump 03:04  you can paste the html on pastebin.com and you can upload screenshots to bayimg.com unless you want to keep it private 03:05  if you want to email we can do that too 03:05  Prefer to keep it private since this is an internal corporate site for a start up tech venture. 03:05  sure 03:05  get it? 03:07  okay, on the way 03:09  While you look at it I am going to check out some of the usual Firefox problems and see if it is an issue there rather than XWiki 03:11  looks like you got the wrong html dump, I wanted the one where it was showing the error message. 03:13  hmmm. let me check again. Maybe i sent the wrong one. 03:26  I will have it in a moment. For some reason when I save it gives something different than what is in the source window. It does not include the error. Strange. But I got it via select all and cut and paste. 03:26  ctrl\_u 03:26  \*ctrl+u 03:30  You should have the file now or soon 03:31  oh btw you do cool projects ;) 03:32  Well, if we get one  of the NASA SBIR's we do! Not talking a lot about what we're up to but we're a pretty space-y lot ;-) 03:34  has quit 03:34  heh, this chan is logged so don't say non-public stuff 03:35  ok the 2 directories which are specified in the page, those both have to exist and according to the error message, it looks like one of them doesn't. 03:35  has quit 03:36  ah, is that the tomcat6 one? 03:36  I'm pretty sure the other one does exist so it must be. 03:40  Okay. this path does not exist, but it is what xwiki thinks is the default for this environment: 03:40  #-# Path to openoffice execution profile (serverType:0 only). 03:40  #-# If no path is provided, a default value will be calculated based on the operating environment. 03:40  # openoffice.profilePath=/home/user/.openoffice.org/3 03:40  So any idea what it \*should\* be in an Ubuntu natty? Or should I just go ahead and create a directory? Hmmm. I should see if there is a libreoffice directory near that name 03:41  IIRC you need to create the directory and copy some files into it, let me check... 03:41  Nope. nothing libre near there 03:41  okay. 03:42  I have /home/user/.openoffice.org2/user/3/ 03:43  Are you on an Ubuntu or Debian dist? 03:43  That sounds more redhat or Suse-ish 03:45  I'm using debian lenny 03:47  okay. is there anything in it that wasn't dynamically created? Otherwise I can just try creating the directory it expects and see what happens 03:49  Yup, that was my experience, I had to create the directories then once they were there, everything worked. 03:49  okay. Doing that now. 03:52  Still same error. Directory exists now: 03:52  drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 2011-08-27 20:51 /usr/share/tomcat6/.openoffice.org/3 03:53  which is what it seemed to be looking for as the Ubuntu default 03:53  Should tomcat6 be restarted? Different ownership? 03:54  I don't think you need to reatert tomcat. 03:54  It's too bad you can't see the content of the error, there's something else going on. 03:54  Would it be logged in /var/log somewhere? 03:54  Yes, the catalina.out file should have it. 03:55  I'll check there 03:57  nope. Did a tail -f on it and reran the Update from the window and nothing happened. 03:59  Just to be sure of things, I am going to set the value in the xwiki.properties explicitely and restart everything. 04:02  okay. No change even with the /usr/share path explicit and a full reboot of the VM. 04:05  you can view source and you'll see thw error message which should be displayed when you click on the error tab 04:08  okay, will try that. 04:12  All I see in the source is this: 04:12  
Failed to execute the [velocity] macro
org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: Failed to evaluate Velocity Macro for content [#set($msgParameter=$msg.get("xe.officeimporter.openoffice.parameter"))  
04:12  below that  
04:12  the bottom "caused by"  
04:13  the one you passed to me, the bottom message was:  
04:13  Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: templateProfileDir must exist and be a directory  
04:15  Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: invalid templateProfileDir: /usr/share/tomcat6/.openoffice.org/3  
04:16  try: ls /usr/share/tomcat6/.openoffice.org/3  
04:16  try: ls /usr/share/tomcat6/.openoffice.org/3/  
04:17  yes, it's okay.  
04:17  nothing in the directory though  
04:18  ahh  
04:18  so mode/ownership problem? Doesn't like its own default selections?  
04:18  What I did (and I have no idea if it's the "correct" way) was to copy everything from my directory to tomcat's  
04:19  user@debo8:~$ ls /usr/share/tomcat5.5/.openoffice.org/3/user/  
04:19  3         autotext  basic   database  psprint   Scripts  temp      uno\_packages  
04:19  autocorr  backup    config  gallery   registry  store    template  wordbook  
04:19  and what I did to get that was:  
04:20  cp /home/user/.openoffice.org2/\* /usr/share/tomcat5.5/.openoffice.org/3/  
04:20  -R  
04:20  okay let me see if there is an equiv for tomcat6  
04:20  then ofc chown tomcat55 /usr/share/tomcat5.5/.openoffice.org/ -R  
04:21  okay, here's the problem then. This is a fresh install and there is no tomcat5.5 and the tomcat6 directory is the very one that is empty  
04:22  right, I'm running 5.5 so replace 5.5 with 6  
04:23  exactly. And that gives us the directory which I created manually and which is empty...  
04:23  hmm does that directory belong to tomcat?  
04:24  I copied the files into the directory from a user which had previously run openoffice but thinking about it, that shouldn't be necessary  
04:24  ah, so let me look at the owner ship angle.  
04:30  Nope. But since you use /home/user, I am going to try switching to something like that instead of the default selection. Perhaps it really wants a 'home' directory. Does /home/user have an owner? is it tomcat6 and is that a home directory for tomcat6 in /etc/passwd?  
04:30  on my computer (desktop) I use the user "user" for general stuff  
04:31  I use the user tomcat55 for tomcat stuff and since xwiki needs access to the directory, it's in the /usr/share/tomcat5.5/ directory which is owned by tomcat55  
04:32  try ls -la /usr/share/tomcat6/.openoffice.org/3  
04:34   ls -la /usr/share/tomcat6/.openoffice.org/3  
04:34  total 8  
04:34  drwxr-xr-x 2 tomcat6 tomcat6 4096 2011-08-27 20:51 .  
04:34  drwxr-xr-x 3 tomcat6 tomcat6 4096 2011-08-27 20:51 ..  
04:36  On your system what shows up when you do the Administration->OpenOffice Server ?  
04:37  it's not currently connected, my tomcat based server is in pieces atm  
04:39  ah. I'm going to go a-googling for a little while.  
04:45  I've also got a suspicion that if I restart my Firefox, the javascript problem might fix itself. I'm going to try that also.  
05:02  I found some more docs on it, non of which exactly are applicable but I checked on my laptop where there actually is a user (me) and found that the current Ubuntu/libreoffice has this:  
05:02  ls /home/amon/.openoffice.org/3  
05:02  MIGRATED  user  
05:02  amon@otv2:~$ ls /home/amon/.openoffice.org/3/user/  
05:02  autocorr  backup  config    gallery  registry  store  template      wordbook  
05:02  autotext  basic   database  psprint  Scripts   temp   uno\_packages  
05:03  I'm wondering what might happen if I rsync this across...  
05:09  That seems to have done something. So it appears not to auto-populate. Which means that something, somewhere is wrong because I cannot imagine an install should require this level of deep magic.  
05:10  All I can say is that is what I did, there's probably some instructions somewhere but I never read those ;)  
05:10  The author of the office code is mflora who is not here atm  
05:14  Now that I have it running, the next question is how to use it, then how to explain it to a non-computer tech writer...  
05:14  You have exported pdf documents before right?  
05:14  Yep. What I'm looking for is the ability for them to work in their familiar Word environment  
05:15  And to cut and paste links and have it work afterwards...  
05:15  When you export pdf documents now, it will use the openoffice as the backend  
05:16  So do I have to open a new document in some special way to get it in an open office word format and then copy content into it?  
05:16  Or should the office stuff work on existing pages?  
05:17  Well, the export is fine, but it is primarily the live edit that has been the big issue  
05:18  There is also office import but I have not done it so you will need to read up on how that works.  
05:23  I was hoping that the Office Import WYSWYG meant I get to edit in Open office style on the wiki. Perhaps not.  
05:24  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/OfficeImporter  
05:25  Yeah, got that. Looks like it does a lot less than I had hoped.  
05:28  Well, I'm glad I got it working and it will probably be somewhat useful but it is not going to help make our document closer to a real .doc file. There's not even any way to center text, change the font, etc, etc... unless you do it manually in the Source format, which I am not even going to \*IMAGINE\* telling my proposal team to do  
05:30  How would you go about setting the font to Times Roman 12 and creating a centered diagram with text centered under it? Without writing source code?  
05:32  Probably means we have to call an end to the draft at some point, lift the document into a .doc and shift to the old fashioned way for the final drafts, change tags and email...  
05:33  Must be someone here who has done proposals. What sort of process did you use?  
05:35  doesn't the wysiwyg editor support that?  
05:35  I don't see anything for selecting a region and changing the font.  
05:36  ahh I see. No center/font stuff  
05:37  I have to do specific fonts as specified in the Solicitation.  
05:38  It's not an option, it's a requirement.  
05:39  Got to be a way to do it in XWiki and I'll probably feel dumb when someone tells me. It's an Enterprise solution so by definition it's got to be there...  
05:39  What exactly are you doing where font and center is important, I'm just trying to get a picture of what you're using it for since I imagine a wiki as more of a collaborative notepad.  
05:40  The Solicitation document requires that we use Times Roman 12 pt; I have a number of figures and graphics that need to be centered with the Fig n: some-text-description under them.  
05:40  Hmmm... lights just blinked. If I go away its the power going out.  
05:40  http://xoffice.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
05:41  Again, I'm not the expert in this field but it looks like there's yet another component which interfaces with microsoft office allowing it to do just what you were saying.  
05:44  yeah, but that one requires you are on an MS platform. Our VM is Ubuntu Natty; the proposal team are mixed Linux and MS so we trade Open/Libre Office and MS Office .doc files around via email usually, which has been a really serious pain and is what I'm trying to get away from.  
05:46  Oh well, maybe if I play with it awhile I can find some way to utilize it. There has got to be a way to set fonts. I just cannot imagine there isn't.  
05:46  ok so you want one of 2 things:  1. Edit wiki pages in openoffice on your desktop and save them without copy/paste or 2. Font, center, (other things?) in wysiwyg.  
05:46  correct?  
05:51  pretty much. And btw, in documentation on WYSYWYG editor, there is mention of a plugin named font that lets you set things. But someone here last night was saying plugins are obsolete?  
05:51  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor  
05:52  haha different plugins  
05:53  http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin§ion=WYSIWYG  
05:53  it looks like you can enable fonts there  
05:59  found it  
05:59  http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin§ion=WYSIWYG <-- here  
06:00  you go to the plugins section and type font and click the + button  
06:01  then in TOOL BAR section, type in: fontname (it should autocomplete) click + and fontsize (should also autocomplete) and + again  
06:01  then click on fontname and drag it up to the top, so it's before the first | character.  
06:01  same for fontsize, then scroll to the bottom and click save.  
06:06  I'm part way there, but I now have one of the proposals showing in WYSWYG and in regular page display with all of the html tags. In others words, I've badly effed something up and now I have to keep at it until I fix it.  
06:09  The part about dragging them up to the beginning is not necessary, it was a coincidence that I did that and it takes some time and some pounding of ctrl+f5 to get it to flush the cache  
06:10  also on the toolbar list you'll want to add justifycenter justifyfull justifyleft justifyright  
06:11  and to plugins you have to add justify  
06:12  ah, rescued it. Now I go for the justify stuff  
06:13  And probably pretty much everything they've got  
06:13  I just \*knew\* this stuff had to be available somewhere.  
06:20  hmm perhaps I'll mention that this stuff should all be included by default and if loading takes too long and the user is an admin then it might say "You can turn off some features by going [[here]]"  
06:27  This is getting much, much better now. I'll just keep adding as I notice things I need that are missing. But I've got font, justification and colors now. Took awhile to get there and I suspect this in combination with the Office import should make life a lot easier on my folk  
06:27  cool
